result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher Rovon Ward was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:

No contact with firearms.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Christopher Rovon Ward in court.  Sarah Zwach appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
  DOC agent also in court.
Based upon the defendant's compliance with the conditions of probation, the Court ordered that time in the House of Correction, which was ordered as a condition of probation but stayed to today's date, be stayed for use at the agent's discretion in the future.

Defendant Christopher Rovon Ward in court.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
  DOC agent also in court.
The Court finds that the defendant has not been complying with the conditions of probation.  The Court ordered the defendant to serve 10 DAYS of the condition time that was stayed to today's date; the stay on the balance of the time is to continue to the next court date.  Defendant taken into custody.  Filed, signed Order For Commitment Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions.
Case adjourned to 02/19/2016 at 1:30 p.m. for probation review hearing in Branch 36.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for February 19, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Christopher Rovon Ward in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Case was calendared for a jury trial today.
The defendant wants to change his plea.
On motion of the state and pursuant to negotiations, court ordered count 1 amended to Disorderly Conduct, pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1), 939.51(3)(b), 973.055(1).
As to count 1 as amended, and to count 2:
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
. 
State can proceed to sentencing..
. 
  Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  
Court sentenced the defendant to serve 90 days as to each count, consecutive,  in the House of Correction with credit for -0- days served. 
 Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 18 months, concurrent,  with the following conditions:
- Serve 30  days, as to each count,  in the House of Correction; STAYED pending review.
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim unless approved by the court.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge and restitution if ordered, bail on deposit, if any, to apply; remainder to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.
- Pay supervision fees.
- Court set restitution at zero.
 
Received and filed: 
Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
The next court date is in Branch 36.
  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for January 15, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

and defense jury instructions received and filed.
cab

  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT THE COURT FILE.  Present in court is Justice Point Case Worker Monica White.  Case in court due to violation.  Court admonishes Defendant.  No action taken at this time. Case remains calendared for Jury Trial on October 19, 2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 36.

Defendant Christopher Rovon Ward in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Owen Piotrowski for Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case heard off the record. Defense counsel requests case be set for Plea & Sentencing. Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form. Case adjourned for Plea & Sentencing to branch 23.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Received & Filed, Justice Point Report.

Court orders defendant to be monitored by JUSTICE Point for Supervision. Defendant to report to enroll by 12:00 PM on 3/12/2015.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY, to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription. No firearms/dangerous weapons. Comply with No Contact Order.
Bail motion by the state argued. Bail remains the same, but added Justice Point Supervision as a condition of bail.

Defendant Christopher Rovon Ward in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver, received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial before Judge Grady, Branch 23. Original Information, received and filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defendant plead not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 23.  Status conference scheduled for April 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
